author: Special Correspondent
text:
A nursing student was found murdered in a thorny bush at Chokkanathapuram near Panaiyur under Silaiman police station limits late on Wednesday evening.

Police said that the 18-year-old girl, a sophomore of a private nursing college in Tirupuvanam, had gone out to bring back the cattle let out for grazing in the nearby land. However, the girl did not return home even after a very long time.

Her body was noticed in a thorny bush. She had been strangulated with a dupatta. The police suspect that someone would have tried to sexually assault her.

“Only after the post-mortem it could be confirmed whether she was sexually assaulted,” Superintendent of Police Vijayendra Bidari, who inspected the scene of crime, said. One of the earrings of the girl was missing from the body.

The police suspect that a person in the locality, who has been accused of two cases of sexual assault, committed the crime and are on the lookout for him.

Three special teams had been formed to trace him, the SP said.

The body of the girl was shifted to Government Rajaji Hospital here for post-mortem.
title: Nursing student found murdered near Panaiyur
